item.title: The Total Brisbane French Festival
item.description:
Saturday, July 12 – Sunday, July 13, 2014



The Total Brisbane French Festival is back for a complete celebration of French culture, food, wine, fashion and entertainment. This year, the festival will be held over two days, allowing visitors to enjoy even more crepes, champagne and can-can dancing at South Bank Parklands.

Venue: Cultural Forecourt. From 9am each day.

Cost: $5
Bookings: No bookings required.
Venue: South Bank Parklands
Venue address: South Bank Parklands, Cnr Ernest Street, Stanley Street and Grey Street, South Brisbane, Australia
More info: www.visitbrisbane.com.au…

item.title: Tai Chi Qigong
item.description:
Sunday, July 13, 2014, 8 – 9am



This dynamic mind and body activity is invigorating and will help you feel relaxed, refreshed and calm. The easy-to-follow moves are repeated each week to enable participants to get a feel for the gentle flowing exercise 'moving meditation'. Join any week all welcome!

Cost: FREE
Bookings: Not required - For more information contact Australian Academy of Tai Chi and Qigong 3358 1955 or www.livingchi.com.au
Meeting point: Near playground
Requirements: Sun protection and water.
Age: All ages
Venue: Robinson Park (Fairfield)
Venue address: Robinson Park, 221 Fairfield Road, Fairfield, Australia

item.title: Kayak eco adventure - Session 1
item.description:
Sunday, July 13, 2014, 9 – 10:30am



When was the last time you escaped your daily routine to enjoy quality time with friends or family? Have fun paddling as a team in two seat kayaks as you embark on one of the best ways to observe Brisbane's hidden beauty. The guided kayaking adventures are a great way to learn more about the local flora and wildlife of Brisbane waterways as well as having an experienced guide to help with kayaking skills. All associated kayaking and safety equipment is supplied as well as light refreshments. Minimum age 10 years or 6 years if accompanied by an adult.

Cost: FREE
Bookings: REQUIRED - Booking date starts 13 Jun 2014. To reserve your place email to: bookings@vertecadventure.com.au (Sam Skerman 0403 293 533)
Meeting point: At boat ramp
Requirements: Sun protection, water, shoes that can get wet, towel and dry change of clothes.
Age: 10+
Venue: Nudgee Beach Reserve
Venue address: Nudgee Beach Reserve, 18 Fortitude Street, Nudgee Beach, QLD
Boat ramp facilities: Canoe ramp
Boat ramp information: Nudgee Beach Canoe Ramp (off O'Quinn Street, Nudgee Beach, UBD: 111,L16), Status: open

item.title: Park orienteering
item.description:
Sunday, July 13, 2014, 9 – 11am



A recreational activity and sport for all the family. Use your navigational skills and a specially produced map, to discover your local parks and outdoor recreational areas. All ages and fitness levels catered for. You can run, jog, walk, or have a leisurely stroll. You can complete individually or participate in a group. Full instructions given.

Cost: $5 per person over 14 years or $15 per family
Bookings: Not required - For more information contact Queensland Orienteering 3389 6678 or 0423 046 001.
Meeting point: Look for Queensland Orienteering signs
Requirements: Comfortable walking shoes, hat and bring your own water.
Age: All ages - under 14s must be accompanied by an adult
Venue: Grey Gum Picnic Area
Venue address: Sir Samuel Griffiths Drive, Mt Coot-tha

item.description:
Sunday, July 13, 2014, 9 – 10am



Come experience the fitness craze that is taking the world by storm! With an infectious blend of Latin and International rhythms and easy to follow moves Zumba® boasts a global following of millions. Why? It’s FUN, it’s easy, it’s different, it’s effective.

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Sunday, July 13, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Wednesday, July 16, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Wednesday, July 16, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.description:
Friday, July 18, 2014, 9:15 – 10:15am



This is a Zumba fitness calorie-burning class with easy to follow moves to Latin and international music that will give you a total body workout.  Then you will activate and strengthen your abs, butts and thighs with some awesome and effective bodyweight exercises.  This total workout is suitable for all fitness levels as you control how hard or slow you want to go.  Please bring a yoga mat or thick towel.

Cost: FREE
Bookings: Not required - For more information contact Carol Zavala 0425 445 528
Meeting point: By the playground
Requirements: Yoga mat or thick towel, exercise clothes and shoes, sun protection and water.

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Saturday, July 19, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Regional Flavours
item.description:
Saturday, July 19, 2014, 10am – 5pm



Regional Flavours is South Bank’s signature food, wine and lifestyle event. Held in the picturesque South Bank Parklands, it features free entertainment from celebrity chefs and industry experts as well as fresh produce from more than 100 of Queensland’s best providores. This year, Regional Flavours will be held on Saturday 19th and Sunday 20th July 10am-5pm. Celebrating leisure food and lifestyle, visitors at this year’s festival will experience the full spectrum of leisure food in their lives: for health and relaxation; for fun and pleasure; and when slowing down to respect local food sources.

Cost: Free entry
Bookings: No bookings required.
Venue: South Bank Parklands
Venue address: South Bank Parklands, Cnr Ernest Street, Stanley Street and Grey Street, South Brisbane, Australia
More info: www.visitbrisbane.com.au…

item.description:
Saturday, July 19, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.description:

Run, jump fly! A super energetic workshop aimed at building confidence, self esteem and a healthy body. Dress up in capes and design your own mask. item.description:

We'll cover a range of topics including storyboarding, lighting, filming, sound recording and editing.

Regional Flavours is South Bank’s signature food, wine and lifestyle event. Held in the picturesque South Bank Parklands, it features free entertainment from celebrity chefs and industry experts as well as fresh produce from more than 100 of Queensland’s best providores. This year, Regional Flavours will be held on Saturday 19th and Sunday 20th July 10am-5pm. Celebrating leisure food and lifestyle, visitors at this year’s festival will experience the full spectrum of leisure food in their lives: for health and relaxation; for fun and pleasure; and when slowing down to respect local food sources.

Cost: Free entry
Bookings: No bookings required.
Venue: South Bank Parklands
Venue address: South Bank Parklands, Cnr Ernest Street, Stanley Street and Grey Street, South Brisbane, Australia
More info: www.visitbrisbane.com.au…

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Monday, July 21, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Tuesday, July 22, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Friday, July 25, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Saturday, July 26, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Wildlife Friendly Gardens
item.description:
Saturday, July 26, 2014, 10am – 12pm



Bookings required. Do you every wonder why you don’t hear frog calls before rain like when you were a child? Would you like to be able to spot wildlife from your own back door? Perhaps you just want to know how to live humbly with your resident brush turkey, or persuade the possum in your roof to take up residence in the tree by your house. If you would like to know more, then come along to our hands on workshop and learn simple, low cost techniques for creating an urban oasis in your own backyard.

Cost: $7.40 per person. Strictly cash only. Pay on the day.
Bookings: Bookings essential. Bookings open Tuesday 17th June 2014. Bookings essential by 11:59pm, Wednesday 23rd July 2014. For bookings, phone Council's Contact Centre on 07 3403 8888., Maximum - 20 participants. Waitlist - 5.
Meeting point: Free parking available adjacent to Environment Centre.
Requirements: Bring a hat, enclosed shoes, sun-smart clothing, sunscreen and insect repellent, and drinking water.
Age: All children booked in as participants MUST be accompanied and supervised throughout the session by an adult carer/guardian.
Venue: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre
Venue address: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre, 815 Rode Road, McDowall, Australia

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Saturday, July 26, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Juggle-a-rama
item.description:
Saturday, July 26, 2014, 2 – 4pm



Juggling is a physical activity that has been proven to improve both physical and cognitive fitness. It provides a cardiovascular workout and assists with hand-eye and right-left brain coordination. Come and make your very own set of juggling balls that you can keep and then have a ball getting active and healthy while learning the basics of this fun and highly entertaining skill.

Cost: $5
Bookings: REQUIRED - To reserve your place and/or for further information go to www.bazilgrumble.com.au
Meeting point: At the blue shade sails
Requirements: Sun protection and water.
Age: 5+
Venue: The Lake Parklands
Venue address: The Lake Parklands, 7 Blue Lake Court, Forest Lake, Qld, Australia

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Sunday, July 27, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Dragon boating
item.description:
Sunday, July 27, 2014, 9:30 – 11:30am



Have fun learning how to paddle in a 12m dragon boat and see the city from a different perspective. Paddling will be on Breakfast Creek and out onto the river. The session includes a warm-up, paddling and safety instruction, and time on the water. Wear clothes and footwear that you don't mind getting wet and remember to be sunsmart so slip, slop and slap. Children must be accompanied by an adult.

Cost: FREE
Bookings: Not required - For more information contact Te Waka Dragons 0410 463 494.
Meeting point: At the under cover picnic area in the park

Venue: Yowoggera Park
Venue address: Yowoggera Park, Sandgate Road, Albion, Australia

item.description:
Sunday, July 27, 2014, 11am – 1pm



The Family Cycling Course is a great way for all family members to learn the basic cycling skills needed to get out and safely enjoy Brisbane’s fantastic off-road cycling network. Skills covered will include basic bike handling, safety checks, starting, stopping, turning and balance.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings required. Email info@cycleaway.com.au or phone Cycle Away on 0427 431 481.
Meeting point: Wynnum Jetty, Wynnum Esplanade
Requirements: Bike, helmet, clothing appropriate for cycling, closed in shoes, sunscreen and water bottle.
Age: For families with children aged 7-12 years. Children must be able to cycle without training wheels. Maximum of two children per adult attending.
Venue: Wynnum Wading Pool Park
Venue address: Wynnum Wading Pool Park, 173 Wynnum Esplanade, Wynnum, Qld, Australia

item.title: Raven Street Reserve Guided Walk
item.description:
Tuesday, July 29, 2014, 9:30 – 11:30am



Bookings required. Join a Downfall Creek Bushland Centre Education Officer on a 3km guided walk through Raven Street Reserve. This Reserve provides protection for more than 200 native plant and 115 bird species.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings essential. Maximum - 10 participants. Waitlist - 5. For bookings, phone Council on 3403 8888., Bookings open Tuesday 17 June 2014. Bookings closed at 11:59pm, Thursday 24 July 2014.
Meeting point: Raven Street Reserve - UBD Map 119 F16.
Requirements: Moderate fitness is required to walk on hilly pathways and some stairs. Participants must wear a hat, fully enclosed shoes walking shoes, sunsmart clothing, sunscreen, and insect repellent. Bring drinking water in a reusable bottle.
Age: All children MUST be accompanied and supervised by an adult throughout.
Venue: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre
Venue address: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre, 815 Rode Road, McDowall, Australia

item.title: Lagoon loop ride plus the gateway bridge (easy to moderate pace) - Free ride
item.description:
Wednesday, July 30, 2014, 9:30am – 12:30pm



After riding a loop around the lagoon we will tackle the Gateway Bridge for some great views, grab a coffee at a local café on the Northern side of Brisbane River and then return. Distance is approximately 25kms and suitable for riders with some bike experience and fitness. There is a steep climb up to the top of the gateway, out and back, but can be done at your own pace. No bookings required. Just be at the meeting point 15 minutes before the ride starts.

Cost: FREE
Bookings: Not required - Just be at the meeting point 15 minutes before the ride starts. For more information contact Bushranger Bikes 3139 1402/0409 053 694.
Meeting point: Off Wynnum Road, car park near the lake
Requirements: Bike, helmet, gloves (optional), clothing appropriate for cycling, closed in shoes, sunscreen and water bottle. Bikes and equipment can be hired from Bushranger Bikes for $15 per person per activity. This must be arranged in advance.
Age: All ages
Venue: Minnippi Parklands
Venue address: Minnippi Parklands, Stanton Road, Tingalpa, Australia
Boat ramp facilities: Canoe ramp
Boat ramp information: Carina Canoe Ramp, Status: open, Location of ramp: Kate Street, Carina

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Wednesday, July 30, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Thursday, July 31, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Thursday, July 31, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free

Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Friday, August 1, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.description:
Friday, August 1, 2014, 3:30 – 4:30pm



This program is guaranteed to keep the kids active with lots of action in the outdoors. Activities include putting up tents, orienteering, parachute games, super rockets, bush walking, water squirting challenges, obstacle courses and treasure hunts! Parents are encouraged to participate. Bookings are not required.

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Saturday, August 2, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Twilight yoga in the Gardens
item.description:
Saturday, August 2, 2014, 4 – 5pm



Come and join yoga instructor and nutrition coach, Anne Noonan, for Yoga in the Gardens. Anne is passionate about health, staying youthful and is a true believer in the power of yoga for strength, flexibility and centredness. She is looking forward to giving back to the community by bringing yoga to the Gardens.

Bring your own mat and water.

Venue: outside on the Adminstration Building lawn (opposite the Planetarium)

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Sunday, August 3, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Body moving, body potting
item.description:
Sunday, August 3, 2014, 10am – 12pm



Get moving with a discovery walk to collect items such as leaves and twigs to create textures on clay. Then get potting and use your hands, feet, elbows or ears as moulds to make your own clay pots. Decorate them using the items collected during your walk.

This event is for people aged 50 and over.

Cost: $5.00
Bookings: Required - Contact Bazil Grumble on 0411 246 487 during business hours or book on-line at www.bazilgrumble.com.au
Meeting point: Meet at the playground

item.title: Fish wise
item.description:
Sunday, August 3, 2014, 11am – 2pm



We take the tangles out of fishing! You will learn the basics of shore based fishing. Depending on the location you will learn either yabby pumping, bait netting or cast netting. You will also learn to tie your knots, bait presentation, rod casting and lots more. Ideal refresher or beginners class.

Cost: FREE
Bookings: REQUIRED - Please phone 2 Bent Rods 0403 713 820 to reserve your place.
Meeting point: Beginning of jetty
Requirements: Sun protection and water.
Age: All ages
Venue: Wynnum Wading Pool Park
Venue address: Wynnum Wading Pool Park, 173 Wynnum Esplanade, Wynnum, Qld, Australia
Boat ramp information: Boat ramp: Wynnum Esplanade

item.title: Bike Skills Training - Family Cycling Course
item.description:
Sunday, August 3, 2014, 11am – 1pm



The Family Cycling Course is a great way for all family members to learn the basic cycling skills needed to get out and safely enjoy Brisbane’s fantastic off –road cycling network. Skills covered will include basic bike handling, safety checks, starting, stopping, turning and balance.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings required. Email marketing@activcyclecoaching.com or phone Activ Cycle Coaching on 0414 238 496.
Meeting point: Playgournd near soccer club, Baron Street
Requirements: Bike, helmet, clothing appropriate for cycling, closed in shoes, sunscreen and water bottle.
Age: For families with children aged 7-12 years. Children must be able to cycle without training wheels. Maximum of two children per adult attending.
Venue: Thompson Estate Reserve
Venue address: Thompson Estate Reserve, Pine Street, Greenslopes

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Monday, August 4, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.description:
Wednesday, August 6, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.

Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Wednesday, August 6, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

item.description:
Thursday, August 7, 2014, 10am – 12pm



This workshop promotes active and healthy bodies. In the famous song, the five little ducks go for a big walk and in this workshop everyone will have a chance to do that too! Afterwards, everyone can relax on the colourful parachute, sing some songs, hear some stories and get moving with some great games all about your favourite animals!

Cost: FREE

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Thursday, August 7, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Thursday, August 7, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Friday, August 8, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136

Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Night Adventures - Karawatha Forest Park
item.description:
Friday, August 8, 2014, 5:30 – 7:30pm



Bookings essential. Join a guided spotlighting activity with Brisbane City Council’s Environment Centres staff to find out more about Karawatha Forest Park and its nocturnal creatures of the night. Participants will walk 1-2kms throughout the evening, and the activity will continue in the event of light rain.

Cost: $7.40 per person – strictly cash only on the night.
Bookings: Bookings essential. Phone Council on 07 3403 8888., Bookings open Wednesday 2nd July 2014. Bookings essential by 11:59pm, Monday 4th August 2014. Maximum 20 participants. Waitlist - 10.
Meeting point: Acacia Picnic Area, Acacia Road (UBD Map 221 J19). Free parking.
Requirements: Bring a flashlight, insect repellent, drinking water, and a raincoat if there is light rain; wear enclosed walking shoes; long-sleeved shirt and long pants are recommended.
Age: Suitable for adults and children 6 years and over. All children MUST be accompanied and directly supervised by an adult carer (Please note that this activity requires 1 adult per 2 children).
Venue: Karawatha Forest Park
Venue address: Karawatha Forest Park, 149 Acacia Road, Karawatha, Qld, Australia

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Saturday, August 9, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Mountain to mangroves trail ride (moderate to quicker pace) - Free ride
item.description:
Sunday, August 10, 2014, 8:30am – 12pm



We will follow Downfall Creek to Virginia and on to Nundah. After riding some back streets we will pick up the Kedron Brook bikeway and cycle through to Banyo, some more back streets and paths will bring us back to Virginia and then retrace the Mountain to Mangroves corridor back to Raven Street Reserve. Distance is approximately 40-45kms with a mix of bike paths, road sections and some hills. Suitable for riders with some bike experience and fitness. This path is open and it can get hot with headwinds. Bring some change for a coffee. No bookings required. Just be at the meeting point 15 minutes before the ride starts.

Cost: FREE
Bookings: Not required - Just be at the meeting point 15 minutes before the ride starts. For more information contact Bushranger Bikes 3139 1402/0409 053 694.
Meeting point: Downfall Creek Environment Centre, Rode Road, Chermside
Requirements: Bike, helmet, gloves (optional), clothing appropriate for cycling, closed in shoes, sunscreen and water bottle. Bikes and equipment can be hired from Bushranger Bikes for $15 per person per activity. This must be arranged in advance.
Age: All ages
Venue: Raven Street Reserve
Venue address: Rode Road, Chemside West

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Sunday, August 10, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Wednesday, August 13, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Wednesday, August 13, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Cycling the city, river and loop
item.description:
Friday, August 15, 2014, 9:15am – 12:15pm



Easy to medium paced social 25km ride to Toowong along the Bicentennial bikeway, through St. Lucia and the university, over the Green bridge and into the city via the Southeast Freeway bikeway. Meander through Southbank or cross the Goodwill and Go Between bridges and return to West End. Expect some hills.

This event is for people aged 50 and over.

Cost: $15 if bike hire required
Bookings: Not required - For more information or to hire a bike contact Bushranger Bikes on 0409 053 694
Meeting point: Meet at car park
Requirements: Bring your bicycle and helmet if you have one otherwise phone Jon on 0409 053 694 to organise equipment. There will be rest breaks to suit the group. Wear suitable clothing and footwear, bring drinking water and money for a coffee stop.
Age: 50+
Venue: Orleigh Park
Venue address: Orleigh Park, 68 Hill End Terrace, West End
Boat ramp facilities: Single pontoon
Boat ramp information: West End Pontoon, Status: open

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Friday, August 15, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Friday, August 15, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Saturday, August 16, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.description:
Saturday, August 16, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Sunday, August 17, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Japanese Cultural Day
item.description:
Sunday, August 17, 2014, 11am – 3pm



Join the Japan Week celebrations at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, Sunday 17 August 11am-3pm in the Japanese Garden. Enjoy interactive displays of tea ceremony, calligraphy, Ikebana (Japanese flower arranging), Mochitsuki (rice cake making) and live music. Japanese Cultural Day is a free event. All are welcome.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings not required. For more information phone Council on 07 3403 8888 or email culture@bb.mofa.go.jp.
Venue: Brisbane Botanic Gardens, Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mount Coot-tha Road, Mount Coot-tha

item.title: Bike Skills Training - Family Cycling Course
item.description:
Sunday, August 17, 2014, 11am – 1pm



The Family Cycling Course is a great way for all family members to learn the basic cycling skills needed to get out and safely enjoy Brisbane’s fantastic off –road cycling network. Skills covered will include basic bike handling, safety checks, starting, stopping, turning and balance.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings required. Email marketing@activcyclecoaching.com or phone Activ Cycle Coaching on 0414 238 496.
Meeting point: Car parking off Stackpole st, near dog off leash area
Requirements: Bike, helmet, clothing appropriate for cycling, closed in shoes, sunscreen and water bottle.
Age: Ideally for families with children aged 7-12 years.
Venue: Boorabbin Picnic Ground
Venue address: Boorabbin Picnic Ground, 713 Mt Gravatt-Capalaba Road, Wishart

item.title: Cycling the Brook & Mangroves trail - Seniors Week
item.description:
Monday, August 18, 2014, 9:15am – 12:15pm



Easy to medium paced 25km loop ride on the Kedron Brook bikeway to the start of the Boondall Wetlands trail, then through to Banyo and back to Toombul via Virginia and Northgate. Some small climbs, road sections and can be hot.

This event is for people aged 50 and over.

Cost: $15 if bike hire required
Bookings: Not required - For more information or to hire a bike contact Bushranger Bikes on 0409 053 694
Meeting point: Meet at car park
Requirements: Bring your bicycle and helmet if you have one otherwise phone Jon on 0409 053 694 to organise equipment. There will be rest breaks to suit the group. Wear suitable clothing and footwear, bring drinking water and money for a coffee stop.
Age: 50+
Venue: Kalinga Park
Venue address: Kalinga Park, Park Ave, Wooloowin, Qld, Australia

item.description:
Monday, August 18, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Raven Street Reserve Guided Walk
item.description:
Tuesday, August 19, 2014, 9 – 11:30am



Bookings required. Join a Downfall Creek Bushland Centre Education Officer on a 3km guided walk through Raven Street Reserve. This Reserve provides protection for more than 200 native plant and 115 bird species.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings open Wednesday 2nd July 2014. Bookings essential by 11:59pm, Thursday 14th August 2014. Maximum 10 participants. Waitlist 5., Bookings essential. Phone Council's Contact Centre 07 3403 8888.
Meeting point: Raven Street Reserve - UBD Map 119 F16.
Requirements: Moderate fitness is required to walk on hilly pathways and some stairs. Participants must wear a hat, fully enclosed shoes walking shoes, sunsmart clothing, sunscreen, and insect repellent. Bring drinking water in a reusable bottle.
Age: All children MUST be accompanied and supervised by an adult throughout.
Venue: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre
Venue address: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre, 815 Rode Road, McDowall, Australia

item.title: The 'two creeks' trail ride (easy to moderate pace) - Free ride
item.description:
Tuesday, August 19, 2014, 9:30am – 12:30pm



We will explore the Enoggera Creek trail to The Gap returning via the Ithaca Creek Trail. Distance is approximately 25kms and there are some hills, shady bikeways and some back road sections. Bring some change for a coffee. No bookings required. Just be at the meeting point 15 minutes before the ride starts.

Cost: FREE
Bookings: Not required - Just be at the meeting point 15 minutes before the ride starts. For more information contact Bushranger Bikes 3139 1402/0409 053 694.
Meeting point: Car park at the end of Finsbury Street
Requirements: Bike, helmet, gloves (optional), clothing appropriate for cycling, closed in shoes, sunscreen and water bottle. Bikes and equipment can be hired from Bushranger Bikes for $15 per person per activity. This must be arranged in advance.
Age: All ages
Venue: Finsbury Park
Venue address: Finsbury Park, 106A Finsbury Street, Newmarket, Qld, Australia

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Wednesday, August 20, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Wednesday, August 20, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136

Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.description:
Upper Moora Park, Park Parade, Shorncliffe
Thursday, August 21, 2014, 9:15am – 12:45pm



Longer distance and quicker paced social 35-40km ride to suit more experiences and fitter cyclists. Ride from Shorncliffe to Nudgee Beach via Deagon, the Entertainment Centre, the Boondall Wetlands and return. Mainly flat on bike paths and quieter back roads.

This event is for people aged 50 and over.

Cost: $15 if bike hire required
Bookings: Not required - For more information or to hire a bike contact Bushranger Bikes on 0409 053 694
Meeting point: Meet at top car park
Requirements: Bring your bicycle and helmet if you have one otherwise phone Jon on 0409 053 694 to organise equipment. There will be rest breaks to suit the group. Wear suitable clothing and footwear, bring drinking water and money for a coffee stop.
Age: 50+
Venue: Moora Park
Venue address: Moora Park, 65 Park Parade, Shorncliffe

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Thursday, August 21, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Thursday, August 21, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Green Yoga & Green Tea
item.description:
Friday, August 22, 2014, 9:30am – 12pm



Bookings required. Escape the hustle and bustle of city life with a yoga class set amongst the beautiful backdrop of Raven Street Reserve.  Enjoy the sounds of nature as your instructor guides you through a number of poses. Top it all off with a warm cup of chai or green tea. Absolute beginner to intermediate yoga level.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings open Wednesday 2nd July 2014. Bookings essential by 11:59pm, Monday 18th August 2014., Maximum 12 participants. Waitlist 5. For bookings, ring Council's Contact Centre 07 3403 8888.
Meeting point: Raven Street Reserve (UBD Map 119 F16). Free parking adjacent to the Environment Centre.
Requirements: Participants must bring and wear enclosed walking shoes (shoes can be removed to do yoga), comfortable sun smart yoga clothing, own yoga mat or towel, hat, drinking water, sunscreen and insect repellent.
Venue: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre
Venue address: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre, 815 Rode Road, McDowall, Australia

Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Saturday, August 23, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.title: Wildlife Friendly Gardens
item.description:
Saturday, August 23, 2014, 10am – 12pm



Bookings required. Do you every wonder why you don’t hear frog calls before rain like when you were a child? Would you like to be able to spot wildlife from your own back door? Perhaps you just want to know how to live humbly with your resident brush turkey, or persuade the possum in your roof to take up residence in the tree by your house. If you would like to know more, then come along to our hands on workshop and learn simple, low cost techniques for creating an urban oasis in your own backyard.

Cost: $7.40 per person. Strictly cash only. Pay on the day.
Bookings: Bookings open Wednesday 2nd July 2014. Bookings essential by 11:59pm, Tuesday 19th August 2014. For bookings, phone Council's Contact Centre on 07 3403 8888., Maximum - 20 participants. Waitlist - 5., Light morning tea provided. Please advise of any dietary requirements when booking.
Meeting point: Raven Street Reserve. Free parking available adjacent to Environment Centre.
Requirements: Bring a hat, enclosed shoes, sun-smart clothing, sunscreen and insect repellent, and drinking water.
Age: All children booked in as participants MUST be accompanied and supervised throughout the session by an adult carer/guardian.
Venue: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre
Venue address: Downfall Creek Bushland Centre, 815 Rode Road, McDowall, Australia

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Saturday, August 23, 2014, 1 – 2pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Northern suburbs and creek explorer ride (quicker pace) - Free ride
item.description:
Sunday, August 24, 2014, 8:30am – 12pm



We will ride from McDowall and follow Cabbage Tree Creek bikeways and paths through to Bridgeman Downs, Aspley, Carseldine and Taigum to Sandgate/Shorncliffe and then return. Distance is approximately 40-45kms and the ride is on bike paths and roads. Suitable for riders with some bike experience and fitness. Bring some change for a coffee. No bookings required. Just be at the meeting point 15 minutes before the ride starts.

Cost: FREE
Bookings: Not required - Just be at the meeting point 15 minutes before the ride starts. For more information contact Bushranger Bikes 3139 1402/0409 053 694.
Meeting point: Reserve entrance, corner Speilburg Street & Stallone Ct, McDowall (UBD Ref Map 118, Q10)
Requirements: Bike, helmet, gloves (optional), clothing appropriate for cycling, closed in shoes, sunscreen and water bottle. Bikes and equipment can be hired from Bushranger Bikes for $15 per person per activity. This must be arranged in advance.
Age: All ages
Venue: McDowall Reserve
Venue address: Corner of Speilberg Street and Stallone Circuit, McDowall

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Sunday, August 24, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.description:
Sunday, August 24, 2014, 11am – 1pm



The Family Cycling Course is a great way for all family members to learn the basic cycling skills needed to get out and safely enjoy Brisbane’s fantastic off –road cycling network. Skills covered will include basic bike handling, safety checks, starting, stopping, turning and balance.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings required. Email info@cycleaway.com.au or phone Cycle Away on 0427 431 481.
Meeting point: Car park, off Bedivere

Age: For families with children aged 7-12 years. Children must be able to cycle without training wheels. Maximum of two children per adult attending.
Venue: Carindale Recreation Reserve
Venue address: Cadogan and Bedivere Streets

item.description:
Monday, August 25, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.

Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Night navigation
item.description:
Tuesday, August 26, 2014, 6:30 – 8pm



A recreational activity and sport in the cool of the evening. Use your navigational skills and a specially produced map, to discover your local parks and outdoor recreational areas. All ages and fitness levels catered for. You can run, jog, walk, or have a leisurely stroll. You can complete individually or participate in a group. Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult. Please bring a small torch or head lamp. Full instructions given.

Cost: $5 per person or $15 per family
Bookings: Not required - For more information contact Queensland Orienteering 3389 6678 or 0423 046 001.
Meeting point: Look for Queensland Orienteering signs
Requirements: Small torch or head lamp, comfortable walking shoes and bring your own water.
Age: All ages - under 14s must be accompanied by an adult
Venue: Amazon Place Park
Venue address: Amazon Place Park, 44 Amazons Pl, Jindalee, Australia
Boat ramp facilities: Single pontoon
Boat ramp information: Jindalee Pontoon, Status: open

item.description:
Wednesday, August 27, 2014, 9:15am – 12:15pm



Easy to medium paced social 25-30km ride. Follow Ithaca and Enoggera Creeks through many shady parks and suburbs including St Johns Woods and Banks Street Reserve, Ashgrove to Downey Park and into Windsor and return.

This event is for people aged 50 and over.

Cost: $15 if bike hire required
Bookings: Not required - For more information or to hire a bike contact Bushranger Bikes on 0409 053 694
Requirements: Bring your bicycle and helmet if you have one otherwise phone Jon on 0409 053 694 to organise equipment. There will be rest breaks to suit the group. Wear suitable clothing and footwear, bring drinking water and money for a coffee stop.
Age: 50+
Venue: Dorrington Park
Venue address: Dorrington Park, Frasers Road, Ashgrove, Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Wednesday, August 27, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Thursday, August 28, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

item.title: Guided walks in the City Botanic Gardens
item.description:
Friday, August 29, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Bookings: Individuals or small groups don't need to book. Large groups or groups with a special interest can make a booking for a customised tour by phoning 07 3403 2535.
Venue: City Botanic Gardens
Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Friday, August 29, 2014, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Guided nature walk in Boondall Wetlands
item.description:
Saturday, August 30, 2014, 9 – 11am



Join a volunteer interpretive guide on a nature walk and discover the hidden treasures of Boondall Wetlands.

Walks are held on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the year and are suitable for all ages. Children must be accompanied by an adult. The maximum number of participants is 15.

Tracks can become muddy and inundated with water after heavy rains, please bring appropriate foot wear.

Please note that in the event of heavy rain or hazardous track conditions, walks will be postponed.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings are essential. Please book at least 1 week in advance by calling 07 3403 1490.
Venue: Boondall Wetlands Environment Centre
Venue address: 31 Paperbark Drive, Boondall

item.description:
Saturday, August 30, 2014, 11am – 12pm



Learn about the plants and history of the City Botanic Gardens during a guided walk. Walks are taken at a gentle pace for about one hour and are guided by a volunteer.

Walks leave twice daily from the main rotunda at 11am or 1pm, Monday to Saturday.

Find out how to become a volunteer guide.

Venue address: 147 Alice Street, Brisbane City, Queensland, 4000 Australia

item.title: Kayak eco adventure
item.description:
Sunday, August 31, 2014, 1 – 2:30pm



Have fun paddling as a team in two seat kayaks as you embark on one of the best ways to observe Brisbane's hidden beauty. The guided kayaking adventures are a great way to learn more about the local flora and wildlife of Brisbane waterways as well as having an experienced guide to help with kayaking skills. All associated kayaking and safety equipment is supplied as well as light refreshments.

This event is for people aged 50 and over.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Required - Contact Vertec Adventure on 0403 293 533
